conclusion: Determine where the liquid from A, B, and C flows into containers D, E, or F by following the paths through the baffles.
A is at the first position on the top.
Liquid from A flows down directly into the gap next to the black baffle.
The black baffle directs the liquid into the container on the far left.
Liquid from A flows into container D.
Liquid from B flows down and hits the purple baffle.
The purple baffle redirects the liquid to the left side, flowing past the black baffle.
Liquid from B is directed into the middle container.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows down and is partially blocked by the light blue baffle.
The light blue baffle directs liquid from C to the right side.
Liquid from C flows past the yellow baffle and into the container on the far right.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
Final Answer: A flows into D, B flows into E, C flows into F.
